chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Byron K Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility.
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Must pay a minimum of $50.00 per month toward restitution.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must take medications as prescribed.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Work release granted.
Credit for 141 days.
